title: 2005-2009 Mustang Dress-Ups - Hot Rod Garage Ep. 16

comments.text: Putting lipstick on a pig.﻿
comments.author: rudeboymt44

comments.text:
Nice alloy prop shaft !
A little know fact that Mazda uses a Carbon Fiber prop shaft from the 
factory in their RX8. Around half the weight of alloy also stronger.﻿
comments.author: Punchy LightBeer

comments.text:
That moment when you realize that *your* idea of cheap isn't the same as 
everyone else's.﻿
comments.author: lilturk726

comments.text: I hate the captioning! How do I turn it off?﻿
comments.author: Sean Linne

comments.text:
OMG David has shoes on! Great tips, gotta try the mitt! I used claybar to 
take off some clearcoat overspray.﻿
comments.author: 97dakotaman

comments.text: Freiburger seems so skeptical of the magical mitt lol.﻿
comments.author: solofalcon

comments.text: thats just a cool lookin little mustang﻿
comments.author: pyrite stone

comments.text:
I love the looks of the EBC Brakes Mustang, it looks aggressive with the 
black paint and the chunky rims. It's perfect for everyday driving.﻿
comments.author: Gabriel Alvarez

comments.text:
So the wax is like removing pimples from your face except that the face is 
the hood and the pimples are the residue from the streets lol﻿
comments.author: Gabriel Alvarez

comments.text:
Dress ups!!?? Hahahahahhaah! That's what my sister used to do when she was 
about 8 or 9 years old!!!! ROFLMFAOOOOOOOOO !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!﻿
comments.author: wordreet

comments.text:
That prep mitt is awesome i bought it after seeing this and used it for a 
car show, the paint is so smooth like the day we bought it from the guy 
that could get an expensive detail.﻿
comments.author: myskman1

comments.text: BAM!   i love it...﻿
comments.author: 75chrisallen

comments.text:
hi guys, what are the best heads to buy for an auto-trans 91 ford mustang 
coupe. I have ( of course not installed yet. ) BBK SSI 5601 intake, 80mm 
throttle body, BBK headers, 130 amp alt. 190 fuel pump and other things.

comments.author: Noe Montalvo

comments.text: grill light deletion... fail! should have just tinted the lenses.﻿
comments.author: tvalentino3

comments.text:
So what your saying is a hand made 700hp engine in a piece of scrap metal 
is NOT as good of a car to own as a factory built 700hp hellcat engine in a 
comfortable leather seated cruiser such as the hellcat? WOW!! The 
information in this video.. fuck man, I think this should be shown in 
schools as informational videos.﻿
comments.author: Denis Kovacevic

comments.text: X bits = best bits. Haters gonna hate.﻿

comments.text:
1962 dodge lancer gt (roller) sitting next to a donor 99 durango 5.9L , 
come do this !﻿

comments.text: Looks cheap without the fog lights﻿

comments.text:
The car looked better before. Not a fan of the blacked out look. It's a

comments.author: mudemmeonick

comments.text: Why the shoes! Flip flops are totally safe for working in the shop. :)﻿
comments.author: Codidicus

comments.text: I want to see more of this Mustang and the Chevelle as well.﻿
comments.author: David Lopez

comments.text:
Brother Dave, I really enjoy it when you walk us through hot rod stuff. One 
of my third grade students said, "Teacher, you are a good explainer!" I 
wore that title for many tears and now I'm passing it on to you. "Mr. 
Freiburgher, you are the great explainer! You will get your award in 
Chattanooga, TN at the micro brewer of your choice here in town and you can 
drink all you want as I'll be your designated driver.  Im in the 
Collegedale Phonebook/﻿
comments.author: jwyche

comments.text:
Yeah, I did skip to the Q&A. I'm not so interested in making a car pretty 
as making it go fast. So yeah.﻿

I'm shocked ﻿

comments.text: I enjoy watching the whole show..﻿

comments.text: Sad to see the mustang go!﻿
comments.author: Moon Quake

comments.text:
Man - last Video! :( And I just purchased my very own 2005 Mustang. It's 
been a desired purchase for a while. Especially as the 1st year of this 
body style - that I appreciate most. Guess I'll be catching up on previous 
videos. Also I enjoy how relevant your product demos are, as I can readily 
utilize them. Thanks for all the post. Awesome Videos!﻿

comments.text: Didn't know Freiburger speaks Spanish hahaha!﻿

comments.author: leideratus

comments.text:
To be honest, I fast-forwarded it to the Q and A.  I don't care much for 
Mustangs, especially the 2005-2009 model.  It annoys me that all the Hot 
Rod Garage episodes have been about the same car for the past consecutive 
weeks.  Still, great show though!﻿
